hypothesis_content.title: Bull-to-Neutral Warning via Momentum Divergence
hypothesis_content.statement: In BULL regimes, when BTC price makes a new 30-day high but the 14-day RSI fails to exceed its prior high (bearish divergence), AND the Put/Call ratio for BTC options rises above 0.7, there's a 75% probability of transition to NEUTRAL within 3-8 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Momentum divergence at highs during bull markets often precedes consolidation periods. Rising put/call ratio indicates smart money hedging. Combined with negative funding rates, suggests local exhaustion before regime transition.
entry_conditions: RSI(14) < prior RSI high when price made previous high
Funding rates turn negative for 2 consecutive hours

exit_conditions.take_profit: Regime shifts to NEUTRAL OR 5% profit on hedge/short position
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price makes new high >3% above entry with RSI confirmation

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Price continues rallying >10% with RSI confirming new highs
